business-schedule.title: Business to be taken in Westminster Hall
business-schedule.division-heading: Business to be taken in Westminster Hall

business-day.whall-adjournment-debates-introduction: Subjects proposed to be raised on the Motion for the Adjournment:

whall-adjournment-debate-list.whall-adjournment-debate: Future of dairy farming in the UK.
whall-adjournment-debate-list.whall-adjournment-debates-intermission: The sitting will be suspended from 11.30 am to 2.30 pm
whall-adjournment-debate-list.whall-adjournment-debate: Role of HM Revenue and Customs in monitoring imports under the EU-Israel trade agreement.
Water and sewerage charges in the South West.

business-item.title: Debate on the Ninth Report of the Environmental Audit Committee, Session 2007-08, on Carbon Capture and Storage, HC 654, and the Government response, Cm 7605.
Debate on the Report from the Joint Committee on Human Rights entitled Demonstrating Respect For Rights? A Human Rights Approach to Policing Protest.

forthcoming-debates.notice: Applications for General or Short Debates should be made in writing to Mr Speaker to reach his office by 10 pm or the rise of House, whichever is the earlier, on Tuesday 26 January. The Ballot will take place on Wednesday 27 January.

Business, Innovation and Skills; Cabinet Office; Children, Schools and Families; Communities and Local Government; Defence; Energy and Climate Change; Health; Home Office; Justice; Minister for Women and Equality; Scotland; Transport; Wales.
forthcoming-debates.debates-rubric: From the week beginning 8 February 2010, Departments will answer adjournment debates in Westminster Hall according to the following rota:
forthcoming-debates.notice: Culture, Media and Sport; Environment, Food and Rural Affairs; Foreign and Commonwealth Office; International Development; Leader of the House; Minister for the Olympics; Northern Ireland; Solicitor General; Treasury; Work and Pensions.
